channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI Slop Produces Second-Order Mental Health Harm Due The Therapeutic Slop Feedback Loop
item.description: AI slop is getting worse. A big trouble is how AI slop is going to undermine AI-generated mental health advice. I layout the specifics. An AI Insider ...

item.title: Trump’s plan to make housing affordable is faltering
item.description: “We’re not going to destroy the value of their homes so somebody who didn’t work very hard can buy a home,” Trump said.

item.title: Goldman Sachs leads $75 million funding round for Fieldguide, an AI-native accounting and audit platform
item.description: Valued at $700 million, Fieldguide is combating the ‘existential’ talent crisis for the CPA industry.

item.title: 30 years after the founding of ‘Silicon Alley,’ New York’s tech scene is so big it has no center
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Singapore launches first space agency, joining a Southeast Asian race to tap a fast-growing space sector
item.description: The World Economic Forum predicts the global space economy to exceed $1.8 trillion by 2035, up from $613 billion in 2024.

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for renovations after a wave of canceled shows due to Trump adding his name to the building
item.description: Trump announced the closure days after the premiere of “Melania” a documentary of the first lady was shown at the storied venue.

item.title: Don’t Worry, Wall Street. Software Isn’t Dying. Its Role Just Changed
item.description: Anthropic’s Claude Cowork, Stagwell’s ‘The Machine’ and even Moltbolt prove that in an AI-abundant world, value no longer comes from features. It come...

item.title: The Top Open AI Models Are Chinese. Arcee AI Thinks That’s A Problem.

New SNAP work requirements take effect in more states under Trump-backed law
item.description: New SNAP work requirements are taking effect in additional states, expanding eligibility rules and reshaping benefits under a Trump-backed law.

item.title: Costco issues recall notice for bakery item due to undeclared allergen
item.description: Costco has recalled mislabeled "Mini Beignets filled with Caramel" that could cause allergic reactions due to undeclared tree nuts in 22 states.

item.title: Who is Kevin Warsh, Trump's pick to succeed Jerome Powell as Fed chair?
item.description: President Donald Trump announced on Friday that he is nominating former Federal Reserve Governor Kevin Warsh to become chairman of the central bank.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
